lines.text: Yes, I know. We even have Chopin in Shillingworth.
That's the elephant walk where the place got its name. Before the governor built here, the elephants used to come down that track for centuries to get to the water.
They don't still try to come through do they?
She is not one of us and her ways are cold and strange.
Old Tom Wiley still rules Elephant Walk even from his grave.
Let them have their Elephant Walk, Ruth. We'll build a new place, a home somewhere else.
